channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Benny Gantz threatens to leave Israel’s war cabinet if Netanyahu doesn’t meet demands, warning against ‘path of fanatics’ that will lead to the ‘abyss’
item.description: “Personal and political considerations began to penetrate the Holy of Holies — Israel’s security.”

item.title: No ‘cop on the beat’: Why the SEC may deny new ether ETFs this month
item.description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is expected to make a key decision on approving ether ETFs.

item.title: I have $768,000, but want $1 million. How do I achieve that?
Bankrupt crypto lender Genesis gets OK to return billions in tokens and cash to creditors, meaning parent firm DCG ‘is out of the money’
item.description: “Given the size of the creditor claims, DCG is out of the money as an equity holder by billions of dollars,” Judge Lane said.

item.title: Study links talc use to ovarian cancer, adding a potential boon for lawsuits against J&J
item.description: The analysis, released Wednesday in the Journal of Clinical Oncology, found that applying talc powder to the genitals was associated with ovarian cancer.

item.title: Apple has lost its shine. Here’s what can help it regain luster.
Aging while exercising? Great. Just be sure to reevaluate your routine.
item.description: “We need to think about changing the program to be effective and to be safe," notes one expert.

item.title: Activist Corvex could take an amicable approach to help create value at Vestis. How it may unfold
item.description: Corvex reveals a stake in uniform supplier Vestis. The firm is suggesting that it’s here for the long term.

item.title: Trump’s immigration plan could add trillions of dollars to national debt
An oil tanker going from Russia to China is hit by a Houthi missile in the Red Sea, U.S. military says
item.description: The strike Saturday on the Greek-owned M/T Wind caused flooding that knocked out its propulsion and steering, which the crew restored.

item.title: Some consumers are punting big purchases like pools and mattresses
item.description: There are some signs that shoppers are holding off on big-ticket buys, the latest signal of the economy contracting at the hands of tighter monetary policy.

item.title: Roaring Kitty roller coaster: GameStop and AMC meme mania is an ‘outlier event’
Some NYU students being disciplined for protests must reflect on a ‘Simpsons’ episode: ‘What, if anything, could Lisa have done or thought about to make better decisions?’
item.description: One workbook has a section based on an episode of “The Simpsons” in which Lisa uncharacteristically cheats on a test and is wracked by guilt.

item.title: These stocks and ETFs could benefit from AI's voracious appetite for energy
item.description: The power required to operate large artificial intelligence programs could help these investments outside of technology, according to Bank of America.

item.title: Why Cathie Wood’s ARK Innovation ETF is struggling despite a stock-market rally
